revised_title: Influence of Environmental Factors on the Survival Curve of Bact. lactis aerogenes
tldr: This study investigates how environmental factors, such as glucose availability and bacterial strain adaptation, affect the survival curve of \lt;italic\gt;Bact. lactis aerogenes\lt;/italic\gt;. The research finds that shortage of glucose during growth and serial subculture in a synthetic medium lead to initial delays in the decline of the bacterial population. The study also suggests that low permeability and co-operative protective effects are not the main causes of delayed lethal action.
